org.cougaar.planning.ldm.measure
Interface Measure

All Superinterfaces:
java.lang.Comparable, java.io.Serializable
All Known Subinterfaces:
Derivative, Rate
All Known Implementing Classes:
AbstractMeasure, AbstractRate, Area, Capacity, Cost, CostRate, Count, CountRate, Distance, Duration, ElectricPotential, Energy, FlowRate, GenericDerivative, GenericRate, Heading, Latitude, Longitude, Mass, MassTransferRate, Power, Scalar, Speed, Temperature, TimeRate, Volume
public interface Measure
extends java.lang.Comparable, java.io.Serializable

Base interface for all Measure classes. All concrete subclasses of AbstractMeasure are required to implement the method: public static AbstractMeasure newMeasure(String s, int unit); Other AbstractMeasure-level constructors may be defined, depending on each the primative-types that each concrete class can handle. For instance, Distance is based on a double value, so in addition to the above, Distance.newMeasure(double d, int unit) will be defined. The allowed values of the unit specifier depends on (and is defined in) each Measure type. Example: Distance.FEET is a static final int with the correct value for use in constructing Distances in Feet. Each Measure class will also define a getValue(int unit) method returning whatever primitive type it is based on (usually double). All Measure classes are equals() comparable (exact internal value equality), define toString() (the value in a standard unit and a unit abbreviation, e.g. "4.5m"), and define hashCode() (for completeness).

See Also:
for base implementation class of all measures.

Method Detail

getCommonUnit

int getCommonUnit()
Returns:
a commonly-used unit used by this measure. NOTE that this is only a convenience and should not be depended on for computational use, since the notion of a common unit is extremely dependent on context.

getNativeUnit

int getNativeUnit()
The Measure holds the value in a native unit - what is it?

Returns:
the native unit - what the measure uses as the internal unit

getMaxUnit

int getMaxUnit()
Returns:
the value of the highest-valued unit known by this measure. There is no implied relationship between "highest valued" unit and "size" of that unit.

getUnitName

java.lang.String getUnitName(int unit)
The result is undefined if the unit is not valid for this measure class.

Parameters:
unit - to get name of
Returns:
the name of the unit specified.

getValue

double getValue(int unit)
Parameters:
unit - must be in the range from 0 to getMaxUnit.
Returns:
the value of the measure in terms of the specified units.
